metadata.titleEn: Qilian Mountains integrated observatory network: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network (eddy covariance system of mixed forest station, 2021)
metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（混合林站涡动相关仪-2021）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the mixed forest station eddy covariance system (EC) in the downstream reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1 to December 31 in 2021. The site (101.1335° E, 41.9903° N) was located in the Sidaoqiao County, in Ejina Banner in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region . The elevation is 874 m. The EC was installed at a height of 3.2 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3B & Li7500DS) was 0.17 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 10% of the 30 min raw record. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. The water vapor density data were rejected when the negative values occurred. CO2 data were missing due to the sensor malfunction after November 3.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2021年1月1日至2021年12月31日的黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游混合林站涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗四道桥，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E, 41.9903N，海拔874 m。涡动相关仪的架高22m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3B）与CO2/H2O分析仪(Li7500DS)之间的距离是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。冬季水汽密度出现一些负值，进行了剔除。二氧化碳浓度数据在11月3日后出现问题。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为九级（质量标识1-3数据质量好，4-6数据质量较好，7-8数据质量较差（较插补数据好）；9数据质量差））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统和闪烁仪

Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统，闪烁仪，自动气象站

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in an oasis–desert ecosystem?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method employed to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in an oasis–desert ecosystem is the use of an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, which collects half-hourly turbulent flux data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的数据收集方法是使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，这些设备收集半小时的湍流通量数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in data collection within inland river basins in arid and semiarid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，数据收集面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced in data collection within inland river basins in arid and semiarid regions includes the ecological environment degradation such as the drying up of rivers and lakes and the intensification of land desertification, as observed in basins like the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域中，数据收集面临的一个挑战是生态环境的恶化，例如河流和湖泊的干涸以及土地沙漠化的加剧，这在塔里木河流域和咸海流域中得到了体现。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that includes auxiliary data such as hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含辅助数据的示例数据集，例如干旱地区的水文气象、植被和土壤参数？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset that includes auxiliary data such as hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters in arid regions is one that reports long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with hydrometeorological data observed from automatic weather stations and groundwater table data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含辅助数据的数据库，例如干旱地区的水文气象、植被和土壤参数，是一个报告长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的数据集，同时还包括从自动气象站观察到的水文气象数据和地下水位数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features are considered when evaluating the quality of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在评估绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据的质量时，考虑的特征包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: stability of atmospheric conditions, turbulence similarity characteristics
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 大气条件的稳定性，湍流相似性特征

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the sampling frequency used in the data collection method for eddy covariance systems in the field of oasis–desert ecosystem studies?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统研究中，涡度协方差系统的数据收集方法使用的采样频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many stations have been established for collecting energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in the arid regions of western China since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在中国西部干旱地区建立了多少个用于收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据的站点？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the time interval for averaging data in the hydrometeorological observations related to oasis–desert systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 与绿洲-沙漠系统相关的水文气象观测数据的平均时间间隔是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the concept of 'eddy covariance system' in data collection for surface process observations?
Definition.QuestionCn: “涡动协方差系统”是用于表面过程观测的数据收集概念。
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system in data collection is a method used to measure and calculate vertical turbulent fluxes within the atmosphere. It typically involves high-frequency measurements of wind speed, temperature, and trace gas concentrations (such as CO2 and H2O) to assess exchanges of energy, water vapor, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统是一种用于数据收集的方法，用于测量和计算大气中的垂直湍流通量。它通常涉及对风速、温度和痕量气体浓度（如CO2和H2O）的高频测量，以评估地表与大气之间的能量、水蒸气和碳的交换。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'quality evaluation of flux measurements' entail in the context of atmospheric data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在大气数据收集的背景下，“通量测量的质量评估”涉及对通量数据的准确性、可靠性和一致性进行评估。这通常包括检查测量设备的校准、数据采集过程中的潜在误差、环境因素对测量结果的影响，以及数据处理和分析方法的有效性。通过这些评估，可以确保所收集的通量数据能够真实反映大气中的物质和能量交换过程，从而为科学研究和政策制定提供可靠的基础。
Definition.AnswerEn: Quality evaluation of flux measurements in atmospheric data collection involves assessing the reliability and accuracy of the data obtained from instruments, like the eddy covariance system. It includes checks for atmospheric stability, turbulence similarity characteristics, and filtering of data based on errors from instruments, precipitation events, or high data loss in the raw dataset.
Definition.AnswerCn: 大气数据收集中的通量测量质量评估涉及评估从仪器（如涡度协方差系统）获得的数据的可靠性和准确性。这包括对大气稳定性、湍流相似性特征的检查，以及根据仪器错误、降水事件或原始数据集中高数据丢失的情况对数据进行过滤。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with long-term observational datasets in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 与绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测数据集相关的挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges associated with long-term observational datasets in oasis-desert ecosystems include issues such as ecological environment degradation, like the drying up of rivers and lakes, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors can complicate data collection and affect the quality and continuity of the datasets.
Definition.AnswerCn: 与绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测数据集相关的挑战包括生态环境退化的问题，如河流和湖泊的干涸、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素可能会 complicate 数据收集，并影响数据集的质量和连续性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data collection frequency and data types between the mixed forest station and the oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 混合森林站和绿洲-沙漠系统在数据收集频率和数据类型方面有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The mixed forest station collects 10Hz raw data, processed into 30-minute intervals, while the oasis–desert systems acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data and additional data with a 10-minute average period. The mixed forest station focuses on parameters like wind direction, temperature, and CO2 concentration, whereas oasis–desert systems include a broader range of hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 混合森林站以10Hz的原始数据进行收集，处理成30分钟的时间间隔，而绿洲-沙漠系统则以半小时的湍流通量数据和额外的10分钟平均周期数据进行采集。混合森林站关注的参数包括风向、温度和二氧化碳浓度，而绿洲-沙漠系统则涵盖更广泛的水文气象、植被和土壤参数。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges faced in inland river basins impact data collection compared to those faced in the mixed forest station?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域面临的挑战如何影响数据收集，与混合森林站面临的挑战相比有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face challenges such as ecological degradation, drying rivers, and land desertification, which can affect data collection by introducing variability and environmental stresses not present in the more stable mixed forest station environment. These challenges necessitate careful monitoring and adaptation in data collection methodologies to ensure accurate and relevant data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化、河流干涸和土地沙漠化等挑战，这些问题可能会通过引入在更稳定的混合森林站环境中不存在的变异性和环境压力，影响数据收集。这些挑战需要对数据收集方法进行仔细监测和调整，以确保数据的准确性和相关性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in maintaining data quality and consistency when collecting long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的长期能源、水汽和碳通量数据时，维护数据质量和一致性可能会面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality and consistency can include the degradation of ecological environments such as drying rivers and lakes, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These environmental changes can affect the stability of data collection instruments and introduce errors in measurements. Additionally, issues such as instrument malfunctions, data loss during extreme weather events, and variations in atmospheric conditions can complicate the accurate collection and processing of flux data.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 维护数据质量和一致性面临的挑战包括生态环境的退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些环境变化可能影响数据采集仪器的稳定性，并引入测量误差。此外，仪器故障、极端天气事件中的数据丢失以及大气条件的变化等问题也会使流量数据的准确采集和处理变得复杂。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What implications do the patterns of energy and carbon exchange observed in oasis–desert areas have for understanding broader ecological and climate dynamics in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区观察到的能量和碳交换模式对理解干旱地区更广泛的生态和气候动态有什么影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The patterns of energy and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas can provide insights into the ecological balance and carbon cycling in arid regions. Observations indicating that these areas act as carbon sinks suggest their crucial role in offsetting regional carbon emissions and maintaining ecological stability. These patterns can also inform strategies for sustainable development and conservation efforts, particularly in the context of climate change and the expansion of drylands.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠地区的能量和碳交换模式可以为干旱地区的生态平衡和碳循环提供洞察。观察表明，这些地区作为碳汇的作用，表明它们在抵消区域碳排放和维持生态稳定方面的关键角色。这些模式还可以为可持续发展和保护工作提供信息，特别是在气候变化和干旱地区扩展的背景下。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the quality assessment of flux data in oasis-desert ecosystems, and how are these assessments conducted?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，影响通量数据质量评估的因素包括：气象条件、土壤特性、植被类型、数据采集设备的准确性和校准、数据处理方法、时间尺度和空间尺度等。评估通常通过以下方式进行：对比不同数据源、使用统计分析方法评估数据的可靠性、进行现场验证、分析数据的时间序列特征以及评估数据的完整性和一致性等。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The quality assessment of flux data in oasis-desert ecosystems involves evaluating data based on parameters like atmospheric stationarity and turbulence similarity characteristics. The data processing techniques include despiking, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, and density correction. The quality of the flux data is further classified into nine levels, with levels 1 to 3 indicating good quality.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，通量数据的质量评估涉及根据大气平稳性和湍流相似性特征等参数进行评估。数据处理技术包括去尖峰、时间延迟修正、坐标旋转、频率响应修正和密度修正。通量数据的质量进一步分为九个等级，其中1到3级表示良好质量。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to apply data corrections, such as delay time correction and coordinate rotation, when processing eddy covariance data in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在处理干旱地区的涡度协方差数据时，应用数据修正（如延迟时间修正和坐标旋转）是必要的，原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Data corrections like delay time correction and coordinate rotation are necessary to accurately account for the time lag in sensor response and to align the coordinate system of measurements with the mean wind direction. These corrections help in obtaining precise measurements of fluxes like heat, water vapor, and carbon dioxide, which are crucial for understanding energy and material exchanges in arid and semi-arid ecosystems.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 数据修正，如延迟时间修正和坐标旋转，是必要的，以准确考虑传感器响应中的时间滞后，并将测量的坐标系统与平均风向对齐。这些修正有助于获得热量、水蒸气和二氧化碳等通量的精确测量，这对于理解干旱和半干旱生态系统中的能量和物质交换至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges faced in maintaining long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions, and how do these challenges affect data collection?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，维持能源、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测面临的主要挑战是什么，这些挑战如何影响数据收集？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The primary challenges in maintaining long-term observations in arid regions include ecological degradation such as drying of water bodies, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms. These factors can disrupt data collection, lead to gaps in datasets, and necessitate rigorous data processing and quality control measures to ensure the reliability and continuity of the data collected over time.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，维持长期观测的主要挑战包括生态退化，如水体干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些因素可能会干扰数据收集，导致数据集出现空白，并需要严格的数据处理和质量控制措施，以确保所收集数据的可靠性和连续性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using Eddypro software for processing turbulent flux data on the quality and reliability of the data collected from oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用Eddypro软件处理来自绿洲-沙漠生态系统的湍流通量数据可能对数据的质量和可靠性产生哪些潜在后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using Eddypro software for processing turbulent flux data can lead to more reliable and quality-controlled data due to steps like outlier removal, delay time correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, and density correction. This enhances the data's accuracy and aids in quality evaluation via atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity testing, allowing for better assessment of oasis-desert interactions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用Eddypro软件处理湍流通量数据可以提高数据的可靠性和质量控制，原因包括异常值去除、延迟时间修正、坐标旋转、频率响应修正和密度修正。这增强了数据的准确性，并通过大气稳定性和湍流相似性测试有助于质量评估，从而更好地评估绿洲-沙漠相互作用。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the challenges of ecological degradation in inland river basins influence the methods and frequency of data collection in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域的生态退化挑战可能会如何影响在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中数据收集的方法和频率？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The challenges of ecological degradation in inland river basins could necessitate more frequent and comprehensive data collection, including long-term observations and diverse datasets covering energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. Such extensive data collection efforts are crucial for understanding and mitigating the effects of phenomena like river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, and desertification on oasis-desert systems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 内陆河流域生态退化的挑战可能需要更频繁和全面的数据收集，包括长期观察和涵盖能量、水汽和碳交换的多样化数据集。这种广泛的数据收集工作对于理解和减轻河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化以及绿洲-沙漠系统沙漠化等现象的影响至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the consequences of integrating hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameter datasets with turbulent flux data for understanding carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将水文气象、植被和土壤参数数据集与湍流通量数据集整合，对于理解绿洲-沙漠地区的碳交换可能会产生以下后果：
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameter datasets with turbulent flux data could lead to a more nuanced understanding of carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas. This comprehensive approach allows for exploring interactions between various environmental factors and their impact on carbon cycling, potentially improving strategies for ecological stability and sustainable development in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将水文气象、植被和土壤参数数据集与湍流通量数据集整合，可以更深入地理解绿洲-沙漠地区的碳交换。这种综合方法允许探索各种环境因素之间的相互作用及其对碳循环的影响，可能改善这些地区生态稳定性和可持续发展的策略。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to maintain long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems when collecting data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在收集关于能量、水汽和碳交换的数据时，维护对绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观察是至关重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intentions behind establishing a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集的意图是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是在绿洲-沙漠地区实现碳达峰和碳中和，支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to include a variety of parameters, such as hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil, when developing datasets for oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在开发绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集时，包含水文气象、植被和土壤等多种参数是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: These parameters are crucial to provide a comprehensive understanding of the oasis–desert interactions and support the ecological stability and sustainable development of the oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这些参数对于提供对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的全面理解至关重要，并支持绿洲的生态稳定性和可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are eddy covariance systems utilized to collect long-term data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统如何用于收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期数据。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems, such as those mentioned with a sampling frequency of 10Hz, are used to collect half-hourly turbulent flux data. The data include measurements of wind direction, horizontal wind speed, and other parameters, which are then processed to ensure quality and accuracy. This involves steps like coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, and quality assessment based on atmospheric stability and similarity tests.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统，例如以10Hz的采样频率进行测量的系统，用于收集半小时的湍流通量数据。这些数据包括风向、水平风速和其他参数的测量，然后进行处理以确保质量和准确性。这涉及坐标旋转、频率响应校正以及基于大气稳定性和相似性测试的质量评估等步骤。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges faced in data collection and quality control for ecological monitoring in arid and semiarid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，生态监测的数据收集和质量控制面临的主要挑战有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges in these regions include ecological degradation such as drying rivers, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. The quality control procedures must address issues like instrument malfunction, data loss due to adverse weather conditions, and the removal of erroneous data, particularly during precipitation events or when significant data gaps exist.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 这些地区面临的挑战包括生态退化，如河流干涸、土地沙漠化和频繁的沙尘暴。质量控制程序必须解决仪器故障、由于恶劣天气条件导致的数据丢失，以及在降水事件或存在显著数据缺口时去除错误数据的问题。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are implemented to ensure the accuracy and reliability of flux data collected from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了确保从人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统收集的通量数据的准确性和可靠性，实施了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure accuracy, data from eddy covariance systems undergo preprocessing with steps like outlier removal, time delay correction, and multiple coordinate rotations. The datasets are further refined by excluding data collected during instrument errors, immediately before or after precipitation, and when the original data has a significant proportion of missing values. Data quality is assessed through specific quality flags that categorize data based on reliability.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保准确性，涡度协方差系统的数据经过预处理，包括异常值去除、时间延迟修正和多次坐标旋转。数据集进一步通过排除在仪器错误期间、降水前后立即收集的数据，以及原始数据缺失值比例显著的数据进行精炼。数据质量通过特定的质量标志进行评估，这些标志根据可靠性对数据进行分类。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing techniques enable the transformation of raw 10Hz data into usable 30-minute data intervals for surface flux measurements?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据处理技术能够将原始的10Hz数据转换为可用于表面通量测量的30分钟数据间隔？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The data processing techniques include outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation (double rotation), frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Additionally, quality evaluations for each flux value are performed, primarily testing for atmospheric stationarity (Δst) and turbulence similarity characteristics (ITC).
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理技术包括异常值去除、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转（双重旋转）、频率响应校正、超声虚温校正和密度（WPL）校正。此外，还对每个通量值进行质量评估，主要测试大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What infrastructure and technological setups enable the continuous collection of hydrometeorological and turbulent flux data in remote desert and oasis environments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些基础设施和技术设置能够在偏远的沙漠和绿洲环境中持续收集水文气象和湍流通量数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The infrastructure includes an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for turbulent flux data, as well as automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data. These setups record information on radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture, with data collected at various intervals, such as 10-minute averages.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 基础设施包括一个涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，用于获取湍流通量数据，以及自动气象站用于获取水文气象数据。这些设备记录辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度等信息，数据以不同的时间间隔收集，例如10分钟平均值。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems in terms of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的能量、水汽和碳交换平衡方面，可能会面临挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation, such as drying rivers, degraded vegetation, intensified desertification, and frequent dust storms, which complicate maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化，如河流干涸、植被退化、沙漠化加剧和频繁的沙尘暴，这使得维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡变得复杂。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the potential reasons for the discrepancies in carbon concentration data observed in oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中观察到的碳浓度数据差异的潜在原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Potential discrepancies in carbon concentration data could be due to issues like instrument errors, environmental conditions affecting data quality, and challenges in data processing such as correcting for density and frequency responses.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 碳浓度数据中的潜在差异可能是由于仪器错误、环境条件影响数据质量以及数据处理中的挑战，例如校正密度和频率响应等问题。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for long-term observations in understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时需要进行长期观测？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are necessary to achieve a quantitative understanding of these exchanges, recognize oasis–desert interactions, and ensure ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于实现对这些交换的定量理解、识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，以及确保绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展是必要的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using the Eddypro software for processing eddy covariance data, considering the specific data treatment steps involved?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您将如何评估使用Eddypro软件处理涡度协方差数据的有效性，考虑到涉及的具体数据处理步骤？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of Eddypro software for processing eddy covariance data appears to be effective given the detailed steps involved, such as despiking, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. These steps suggest a comprehensive approach to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用Eddypro软件处理涡度协方差数据似乎是有效的，因为涉及到的详细步骤，如去尖峰、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、声学虚温校正和密度（WPL）校正。这些步骤表明了一种全面的方法，以确保数据的质量和准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your perspective on the challenges faced by inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas when collecting long-term observational data?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域在收集长期观测数据时面临的挑战的看法是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face significant challenges in data collection due to ecological degradation, such as drying rivers, vegetation degradation, increased desertification, and dust storms. These factors complicate long-term data collection efforts and require robust methodologies to ensure consistent and reliable data.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临着数据收集的重大挑战，这些挑战源于生态退化，如河流干涸、植被退化、沙漠化加剧和沙尘暴。这些因素使长期数据收集工作变得复杂，需要强有力的方法论来确保数据的一致性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unclear on how data collection methods in oasis–desert ecosystems ensure the accuracy of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange measurements over long periods.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不清楚在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集方法如何确保能量、水蒸气和碳交换测量在长时间内的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods include using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for half-hourly turbulent flux data, supplemented by hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. The process involves data collection, processing, and archiving to maintain accuracy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，辅以来自自动气象站的10分钟平均的水文气象数据。该过程涉及数据收集、处理和归档，以保持准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the challenges faced during data collection in arid and semiarid regions, particularly in maintaining the quality of datasets over time.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在干旱和半干旱地区进行数据收集时面临的挑战，特别是在保持数据集质量方面。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological environment degradation such as drying up of rivers, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors can impact data quality, necessitating careful data processing and quality control procedures.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态环境退化，如河流干涸、自然植被退化、沙漠化加剧和频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素可能会影响数据质量，因此需要谨慎的数据处理和质量控制程序。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how datasets from oasis–desert systems can be expanded or refined to support ecological security and sustainable development.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定如何扩展或完善来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集，以支持生态安全和可持续发展。
Assertion.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange is crucial, requiring long-term observations. Datasets are derived from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations and are available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, potentially allowing for data expansion and refinement.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 对能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要，这需要长期观测。数据集来自11个陆面通量和气象站，并可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取，可能允许数据的扩展和精细化。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection methods used for energy, water vapor, and carbon flux observations in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中用于能量、水蒸气和碳通量观测的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the field of oasis–desert ecosystems, data collection methods include using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data. Additionally, hydrometeorological data is gathered through automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period, measuring radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Vegetation and soil parameters are also collected to supplement the datasets.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统领域，数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据。此外，通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期收集水文气象数据，测量辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。还收集植被和土壤参数以补充数据集。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and explain the main challenges faced in data collection for inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别并解释在干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域数据收集面临的主要挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face several ecological challenges that affect data collection, including the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrence of dust storms. These challenges complicate the ecological monitoring and data collection efforts, especially in areas along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临着多种生态挑战，这些挑战影响了数据收集，包括河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴。这些挑战使得生态监测和数据收集工作变得复杂，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的地区，如塔里木河流域、咸海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential sources or strategies for refining datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集的潜在来源或策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To refine datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, researchers can utilize a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, which include long-term measurements from 2012 to 2021. These datasets are supplemented with auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. Moreover, the data processing and quality control procedures are crucial, involving steps like data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing, ensuring high-quality and comprehensive datasets.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了精炼与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换相关的数据集，研究人员可以利用来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的一系列观测数据集，这些数据集包括2012年至2021年的长期测量。这些数据集还辅以涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。此外，数据处理和质量控制程序至关重要，包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享等步骤，以确保数据集的高质量和全面性。
